intro: Wellstedia dinteri subsp. gracilior, commonly known as the slender wellstedia, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in compact heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and requires minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
